title: Valentine-themed “Will you be my valentine fizza?” single-page site

requirements.summary: Implement a responsive single-page layout that prominently displays the headline and an English subtitle/instruction.
acceptanceCriteria: On load, the page clearly shows the headline text “Will you be my valentine fizza?”
All user-facing text is in English
The page works on mobile and desktop and fits without horizontal scrolling

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React + TypeScript view that renders the headline “Will you be my valentine fizza?” plus an English subtitle/instruction, with a responsive layout that avoids horizontal scrolling. Use Shadcn UI composition patterns (token-based styling and reusable UI building blocks). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add accessible interactive Yes/No buttons where Yes shows a celebration state and No triggers a playful, non-destructive reaction.
acceptanceCriteria: There are clearly labeled “Yes” and “No” buttons
Clicking “Yes” transitions to a visible success/celebration state (e.g., message + animation)
Clicking “No” triggers a playful non-destructive reaction (e.g., message change and/or button movement)
Keyboard navigation works (Tab/Enter/Space) and buttons have visible focus states

file_operations.description: Add state-driven Yes/No interactions: Yes transitions to a clear success/celebration UI state; No triggers a playful alternate reaction (e.g., changing helper text, gently repositioning/animating the No button, or swapping microcopy) while keeping the page usable and accessible. Ensure button semantics, visible focus styles, and an accessible announcement area (e.g., aria-live) for reaction text. Use Shadcn UI composition patterns for buttons and celebratory UI elements. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Extend Tailwind animation/keyframes to support the celebratory success motion and the playful non-destructive No reaction (e.g., subtle wiggle/bounce/float) while keeping focus visibility intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Define and apply a coherent Valentine + pizza (“fizza”) visual theme across the whole site, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is apparent across layout, buttons, and text
The palette is not predominantly blue/purple
Typography and spacing are consistent across screen sizes

file_operations.description: Create the global Tailwind + theme tokens stylesheet (as imported by frontend/src/main.tsx). Define a cohesive Valentine + pizza palette (e.g., warm reds, tomato, cream, basil green accents), typography, spacing, and consistent focus ring styling using token-based values compatible with Shadcn UI composition. Ensure styling remains responsive and not blue/purple-dominant. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply the global theme consistently across layout, typography, and interactive elements (headline, subtitle, buttons, success state), using Tailwind utilities and the shared token system to keep spacing and typography consistent across breakpoints. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and render the required generated hero and background-pattern images as static frontend assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames
The page visibly uses the hero illustration and background pattern
Images load correctly in production build (no backend routing for images)

file_operations.description: Add the generated static hero illustration asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/fizza-hero.dim_1200x800.png.
Add the generated static seamless background pattern asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/fizza-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png.

Render frontend/public/assets/generated/fizza-hero.dim_1200x800.png as the main hero illustration and apply frontend/public/assets/generated/fizza-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png as a subtle repeating background/pattern in the page layout. Ensure assets are referenced as static public assets so they load in production builds. Use Shadcn UI composition patterns for layout structure. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
